text: The mission may fail or be canceled midway if the region is destroyed, but occupying the region will still grant the hero.
Three Stars of Xingpo · Part 1

The Raven Guard army is stationed at Xingpo under the Moon Empress's orders, protecting the Celestial Observatory and rooting out heresy. The Grandmaster "Raven Guardian" is also present in this city and will support the Dragon's endeavors if circumstances require it.
Complete the follow-up mission to seek rewards.
Three Stars of Xingpo · Part 2

One of the Three Stars of Xingpo, deeply versed in the Dao, appears sometimes as human, sometimes as a raven, making it hard to discern their true form. Initially feared by many alchemists, their heart is with the people, leading the Raven Guard and serving the Moon Empress. With great deeds in safeguarding the nation, they are a vital asset to the Celestial Observatory.
A [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]] legendary hero will join your faction.
The mission may fail or be canceled midway if the region is destroyed, but completing the mission will still grant units.
Complete the follow-up mission to seek rewards.
A legendary unit will join your elite recruitment pool (but you must reach a fixed level to unlock recruitment).
The Three Great Beasts of Cathay: Xuanwu · Part 1

In the northern lands, under the Seven Lunar Mansions, the Xuanwu, a turtle-snake intertwined in eternal union, stands as the guardian of the north under the Dragon Emperor's command. The Astronomers of the Celestial Observatory believe this mighty beast slumbers beneath the high walls of Ao Gate. Its power will clear obstacles in our path; we must immediately march to this city!
The Three Great Beasts of Cathay: Xuanwu · Part 2
Xuanwu's power will shield our armies. Earn the great beast's trust and show Xuanwu our resolve to protect the realm.
The Three Great Beasts of Cathay: Baihu · Part 1

In the western reaches, Baihu embodies the essence of metal, harmonizing the Five Elements, sustaining balance in the world under the Dragon Emperor's mandate. The deserts of the Dimensional Stone are home to bizarre and feral creatures, yet this immaculate beast reigns supreme. Baihu's arrival will enable us to crush any enemies who dare obstruct our path. We must venture to Shanyang and seek an alliance with the Master of Battle.
The Three Great Beasts of Cathay: Baihu · Part 2
Baihu's power will annihilate our enemies, but first, we must prove our worth. The immaculate beast has emerged from the sands; now, battle the Master of Battle!
The Three Great Beasts of Cathay: Zhuque · Part 1

In the southern lands, under the blazing sun, the vermilion phoenix calls from the parasol trees, commanding all avians to submit. Zhuque, the guardian of the south under the Dragon Emperor's command, defends Fuhong and the whole Southern Riftlands with its followers. With Chaos looming over us, we should seek the favor of this mighty phoenix.
The Three Great Beasts of Cathay: Zhuque · Part 2

Zhuque's power will bless every warrior of Cathay. Atop the endless steps of its sacred temple, the strongest guardians of the divine bird stand silent behind their masks, as flames rise high above the shrine. The Southern Riftland's guardian beast has revealed itself; pass its trials and receive the Mother of New Life's blessing.
Shadows in the Bamboo Grove · Part 1
Residents of Hao Yue Village report increasingly frequent appearances of enormous footprints in the local bamboo grove. Whether friend or foe, we must uncover the source.
Shadows in the Bamboo Grove · Part 2

Incredibly, so close to the Jade Court, a subhuman creature appears to exist. It resembles the iron-eating beasts ridden by the Tiger Generals, perhaps another creation of the winds of magic. Showing no hostility toward humans, we might attempt to approach it.
Wings of the Storm · Part 1
The lake beneath the Tongtian Bridge is whipped into chaos by a violent storm, while unnatural rain and thunder plague the nearby villages. We must investigate before the situation worsens.
Wings of the Storm · Part 2

By the Dragon Emperor's decree, the Tongtian Bridge shines once again, and a mighty creature takes flight! Known among the people as "Thunder Duke", this ancient race forged an alliance with the Dragon Emperor during Cathay's founding. This individual seems to have been disoriented by some interference, lost within the bridge's magical pathways. Though eons have passed, its oath to the Dragon Emperor should still hold true.
The Celestial Court commands all dragons and provincial nobles to convene in the capital, likely concerning Cathay's military authority. We must hurry to the Imperial City to seize the initiative!

The Dragon Emperor proclaims the world is in chaos, with the princes and nobles pursuing selfish aims and fostering discord. The provinces stand isolated and vulnerable as turmoil looms. Only those who summon and unite the Eight Celestial Legions to command all forces under heaven will receive the Tiger Talisman and be granted supreme authority!
Soaring Crane · Part 1
Soaring Crane · Part 2

[[col:yellow]]The provincial courts of Cathay, along with certain special institutions, each maintain their independent legions. To gain the recognition of the Dragon Emperor and the Celestial Dragon Court, we must secure the support of at least half the provincial forces.[[/col]]
[[col:green]]You will receive the Tiger Talisman, the symbol of Cathay's military authority.[[/col]]

The forces of Chaos are gathering, and the entire world is on the brink of catastrophe... \\n\\nBut we must not stand idle. The lords of the East will unite with the Dragon Empire. The Jade Dragon and the senior Astronomers of the Celestial Dragon Court have arrived at the Celestial Throne to ensure the colossal Tongtian Bridge, damaged by Qingbao Tianzun, can be briefly reactivated. Gather the generals of the provinces and their armies! At your command, the armies of the Celestial Empire will march westward to save the world from ruin alongside the forces of Order.
The End of Times

Seek an alliance with the Order factions far to the west; the End Times are near, and we must unite all available forces. \\n\\n[[col:magic]]Completing the mission will create a portal connecting Wei-Jin to Altdorf (accessible by all).[[/col]]
Any [[img:icon_general]][[/img]] lord or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]] hero can use the Tongtian Bridge to travel between [[col:magic]]nodes[[/col]].
Any [[img:icon_general]][[/img]] lord or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]] hero can use the Tongtian Bridge to travel between [[col:magic]]nodes[[/col]].
Tongtian Bridge Pathway
Tongtian Bridge Pathway
Immortal Soul · Part 1

In Cathay's myths, Xingyao is a legendary giant who roamed the wilderness during the Dragon Emperor's early reign. With strength unmatched, he was ultimately defeated and beheaded by the Dragon Emperor, who buried him in Kunlan Mountain and cast a spell to protect his body. As the winds of magic grow unstable, the ancient spell weakens. Perhaps we should investigate Kunlan.
Immortal Soul · Part 2

Xingyao clashed fiercely with the Dragon Emperor, who beheaded him and buried him in Kunlan. Over millennia, the Dragon's spell preserved his form as he absorbed the winds of magic, allowing his resurrection. With milk-white eyes and a navel-mouth, he dances, wielding shield and axe.
Mother of the Jade River · Part 1

Hou Xi, one of the mighty Cathayan beasts who battled the Dragon Emperor, was ultimately subdued and granted forgiveness in exchange for a blood oath to protect Cathay. Summon our priests and prepare to hear echoes from the ancient past.
Mother of the Jade River · Part 2

Hou Xi contended for supremacy against the Dragon Emperor, angrily unleashing the waters of the Jade River, shattering the Pillar of Heaven and breaking the Earth's balance, thus forming the river's winding course as countless tributaries flowed into it.
Xiangxiangzi · Part 1

Yi Yaohua, the eldest sister of Yi Qing, who achieved great renown in the Third Northern Expedition, serves as the Grand Minister of the Celestial Court. She is the link between the Jade Dragon and mortals, and the envoy between the Celestial Court and the Jade Dragon.\\n\\n"Xiangxiangzi" is blessing the soldiers on the front lines. If we wish to gain her support, we must set out for the Great Bastion immediately.
Xiangxiangzi · Part 2

The Grand Minister of the Celestial Court appears reasonable, but she has her price for aiding you—the soldiers on the front lines are fighting to the death, but the threat of Chaos is unrelenting. The Great Bastion must be restored so that the warriors can find brief solace under its towering walls.

The Sword of Union—one of the Six Swords of Kunlan, sharp as a meteor, swift as lightning, and imbued with immense power to alter the winds of magic. Only the most exceptional individuals can harness its full potential. This divine weapon is currently guarded by the Raven Guard of the Celestial Observatory. If we can earn their trust, the Sword of Union will be ours to wield.
Rodents plague the entire province, leaving the Raven Guard stretched thin. Xingpo is on the brink of disaster. If we offer them aid, we will be rewarded accordingly.
Sword of Union · Part 1
Sword of Union · Part 2
[[col:green]]One of the Six Swords of Kunlan will be collected.[[/col]]
Master of the Heavenly Fleet · Part 1

The engineering prowess of the Phantom Fleet is renowned, even rivaling the unparalleled blind artisans of Southern Heights. These formidable war machines form a critical part of the Phantom Fleet's forces, led by Ying Jin, who remains undefeated to this day. When the King of Nanyang instigated rebellion, Ying Jin, once his staunch supporter, chose to step into the shadows. Rumors suggest he is searching for a way to stop his old friend. If we venture to the Phantom Fleet, we might find a way to bring him back to the forefront.
Master of the Heavenly Fleet · Part 2

This rebellion is an elaborate conspiracy; Qingbao Tianzun's influence has infiltrated every corner of this city during the last invasion. Han Cheng is merely a pawn in the plans of the Dark Deceiver. To prevent further deterioration of the situation, we must secure the support of the rational Phantom clans. The craftsmen and the fleet form the heart of this city; once they are on our side, controlling the city will be effortless.
King of Elephants · Part 1

The southern frontier of the Celestial Empire is home to countless subhuman tribes. Some join Cathay's cause as auxiliary regiments, while others take to the forests and mountains as bandits and warlords. The disputes caused by the Monkey King and the tiger-men have left us overwhelmed, and now we receive new reports: a newly risen subhuman tribe has claimed the western slopes of Tian Mountain, led by a chieftain known as the White Elephant King.
King of Elephants · Part 2

The pale giant beast is fiercely independent, yet it has not entirely dismissed the possibility of cooperation with Cathay. The White Elephant King has presented his terms: if Cathay eliminates his enemies, he will trample the great foes of Cathay into dust.
Epilogue of the Westward Journey · Part 1

Before the Monkey King rose to power in the Central Plains, he was accompanied by various companions on his journey. Some parted ways after their westward pilgrimage, while others remained by his side, conquering the land. After the Monkey King's regime fell, the Celestial Empire accepted some reasonable subhumans from his ranks, entrusting them with significant duties. Marshal Tian Peng, having pledged allegiance to the Celestial Court, embarked on another westward journey with the Monkey King under the Dragon Emperor's decree. Once their trials were complete, Tian Peng was sent south to assist the Candle Dragon in guarding against threats beyond Tian Mountain, including the Monkey King, whom he regarded as a brother.
Epilogue of the Westward Journey · Part 2

Your arrival gives Marshal Tian Peng a turning point. Although the Monkey King claims to have completed the Dragon Emperor's trials, the dragons remain wary of his past. With your mediation, the Monkey King may have a chance to earn Cathay's approval. Though Tian Peng wishes to accompany you immediately, the southern front's battles grow more dire. Until the situation at the Candle Tower improves, the Marshal may find it difficult to leave.
Legend of Heroes · Part 1

During the last Dark Elf invasion, Tang Jingyin, as the leader of the martial alliance, united various schools and factions from across Cathay, culminating in a fierce victory at Xuanyuan, halting the Dark Elf coalition's advance. Many martyrs, including Tang's wife, sacrificed themselves in the battle. Afterward, the "Hero of Heroes" vanished without a trace. Now, in Cathay's moment of peril, Tang has returned, rallying martial artists at the Haotian Hall to rebuild the alliance and restore the nation.
Legend of Heroes · Part 2

Tang Jingyin has gathered martial artists from various schools under his banner and is ready to march toward Xuanyuan once more. Although the previous battle left deep scars, with your assistance, the outcome this time is destined to be different.
Epilogue of the Westward Journey · Part 3

The Monkey King tirelessly sends his monkeys and apes to deliver letters across all courts: the great Monkey King has completed the trial set by the Dragon Emperor. Long ago, he successfully escorted the Dragon Emperor's envoy westward to the land of a thousand gods. While none can verify this, the Monkey King claims it was all at the Dragon Emperor's behest. Now, he seeks recognition from the Cathayan courts, but the Dragons remember his past rebellion all too well, and the noble houses disdain his "wild claims". Yet, if his words hold truth, how can we ignore the will of the Dragon Emperor?
Epilogue of the Westward Journey · Part 4

The Monkey King's court is scarcely a palace. The monkeys dwell behind the waterfall in their hollowed grotto, a place you might call paradise if not for the cacophony of monkey chatter. The Monkey King sits idly on his throne, his eyes lighting up as he recognizes you instantly—your name is known across Cathay. He has meticulously studied which Cathayan figures to sway, at least from a monkey's perspective. In a flash, he is before you, his movements too quick for your eyes. His prowess is undeniable. Were it not for his jovial demeanor, your instincts might compel you to guard against this formidable figure. He invites you to a crude meeting hall pieced together by his monkey soldiers. Now, it is time to talk business.

To gain recognition from the Cathayan courts, the Monkey King requires a figure of substantial influence within Cathay to vouch for him. If you are that person, the Monkey King will gladly ally with you. Now, he wants to share his story.
Heavenly Watcher · Part 1

The Heavenly Watcher was born from the winds of magic, created by the Dragon Emperor as a guardian to oversee both the heavens and the mortal realm. Legend has it that under the Emperor's command, it executed a rebellious dragon prince and claimed its claw. Later, crushed by guilt over killing its kin, it took its own life. The Dragon Emperor grafted the claw onto the Watcher's bleeding neck, and through the winds of magic, it was resurrected. None can say whether the claw carries the Watcher's original consciousness, but it continues to fulfill the Emperor's will, securing Cathay's peace at great cost. Before departing, the Emperor sent the Watcher to Tianshan. Some say it was to keep the southern monsters in check; others believe it was to watch over the punished Monkey King. Since then, the Heavenly Watcher has vanished. Despite having no eyes, its spiritual power is said to observe every corner of Cathay. Should a crisis arise, it is believed the Watcher will return to the mortal realm. We should head to Fuhong to gather more information.
Heavenly Watcher · Part 2

The great bell in Fuhong's temple has been silent for a millennium. The last time its sound echoed through Cathay, the Dragon Emperor still walked the land, and colossal beasts roamed freely. If the Heavenly Watcher still exists, it cannot ignore the bell's roar. Now is the moment Cathay needs it most.
[[col:yellow]]Monkey King’s Battle[[/col]]

After his defeat, the Monkey King fled southward, pursued by Hou Qian with 50,000 celestial soldiers and a coalition of dragons under orders from Yun Xiang. Hou Qian, using cloud-riding techniques, intercepted the Monkey King in Kunlan Mountain. Were it not for the Monkey King being pressed for time, he might have wreaked havoc once more, but instead, he fought hastily. Hou Qian, already a formidable warrior, overwhelmed the Monkey King, piercing his defenses with the dazzling light of his twin-bladed spear. Yet, the Monkey King, with his extraordinary skills, launched counterattacks that stunned Hou Qian. Realizing the dire situation, Hou Qian brandished a mystical axe bestowed by the Elder Immortal of Kunshan and struck at the Monkey King. The Monkey King dodged, leaving only scattered fur, and vanished, leaving the mystical axe to split the mountains, carving a deep gorge.
[[col:white]]Balance of the White Tiger[[/col]]
From the western plains, the white metal embodies harmony, giving rise to the White Tiger. It stabilizes heaven and earth, entrusted by the Dragon Emperor to secure the west.
[[col:threat_high]]Crimson Phoenix’s Cry[[/col]]
To the south under the blazing sun, parasol trees rise. The crimson phoenix cries, commanding all birds to bow. It is tasked by the Dragon Emperor to guard the south.
[[col:magic]]Coiled Serpent of the North[[/col]]
In the northern lands under the seven constellations, the Xuanwu, a turtle and serpent coiled together, stands as the guardian of the north under the Dragon Emperor's command.
Listen to the Monkey King's tale...
After his defeat, the Monkey King was intercepted by Hou Qian in Kunlan Mountain, leading to a fierce battle...
Hou Qian, a masterful warrior, fought valiantly. Joined by Na Zha, the Monkey King's second brother, who had initially fled but returned with a host of demons, the fight escalated.
The Monkey King desperately sought an escape, but Hou Qian's relentless pursuit made it impossible. As they clashed, a fiery streak appeared in the sky—the herald of Na Zha, the Celestial Vanguard.
Aid the Monkey King in fending off his pursuers.
Hold the line against the fierce assault.
The guardian beast has descended. Defeat it and claim its power!
Prove your strength to the guardian beast.
[[col:red]]Final Battle[[/col]]\\n[[col:yellow]]The Dragon Still Stands[[/col]]

Chaos forces are gathering, and the world teeters on the brink of doom... \\n\\nThe Chaos Dwarfs' war machines have breached a section of the Great Bastion, shadowy demons soar over the mountains, and the Everchosen surveys this crumbling empire. Champions revel in the path of destruction, eager to bring Cathay and the world to an end. The battlefield lies in Weijing, where everything will be decided.\\n\\n[[img:icon_yang]][[/img]][[img:icon_yin]][[col:red]]You will face an extremely challenging ultimate battle![[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]]Note: If you choose to confront the true end, all settlements along Archaon's path will fall, and your armies in these areas will be forced to retreat.[[/col]]
The servants of the Dark Gods are at the gates—Weijing must not fall!
Archaon has dispatched his minions from the dark lands. These vile artisans have begun their assault; we must find a way to destroy their killing machines!
The Changeling has emerged from behind the veil—it seems Hou Qian's forces failed to stop it...
The Martial Alliance and Moonlight Sect have broken through the encirclement and rushed from the east. "The rise or fall of the nation concerns everyone!"
Archaon, the Dark Gods' favored champion, has launched his attack. Even if death is inevitable, we will fight to the bitter end!
The champions of Haotian face the Chosen of Destruction—the palaces of the Dragon Gods shall endure the apocalypse!
The iron hooves of cavalry shake the earth. Cathay's banners emerge on the horizon—my lord, reinforcements from the Imperial Guard have arrived!
The flames of the Dragon Emperor's guard scorch Zhatan's chest—my lord, the commander of the Tower of Zharr has fallen!
Arrows imbued with the Moon Empress's power pierce Vilitch's forehead. Tzeentch's champion retreats, dragging his shattered body.
The Dragon God's champion is consumed by the Chaos tide. He was prepared for this moment, knowing no sacrifice is too great to save Cathay.
We've done it—Archaon has fallen! The Chosen is not invincible, and the time for counterattack is now!
The Shadow of Change is exposed under the light of the Gilded Lion. The despicable demon has been banished from the mortal frontier.

Soldiers, the Three Gates are destroyed, the state teeters, and fertile lands lie in ruins. The Dark Gods' minions believe they have broken us, but today we stand before Weijing. We are the Bastion—we are Cathay!
Sons and daughters of Cathay, the Dragon Emperor is with us—hold the line!

A thousand years from now, our deeds will still be sung. No retreat—only forward!\\nLet our courage burn like fire, and let the enemy's fear sound our victory horn! For the Dragon Emperor! For Cathay!

Beneath Weijing lies the home of our descendants; upon Cathay's soil rest the spirits of our ancestors. Soldiers, today we stand with righteousness and will repay the nation with our lives, leaving no shame to heaven or earth!
The winds of magic tremble, and the foundations of the world are shaking. Countless demons encircle Archaon, craving the despair of mortals.
Zhao Qi falls amidst the ranks. The sunlight stings her eyes, yet she refuses to look away. Once she opposed this light, but later aided these short-lived beings—what a strange fate...
The consciousness of the White Fox's descendant fades. Amidst the chaos, she hears the cries of millions of Cathayans and sees the Dragon God walking with his people.
Quehutian charges into the fray, blood spraying and cries resounding. Though he has witnessed countless brutal battles across the wilderness, the scene before him still leaves him dizzy.
Demons tear through the fabric of reality, appearing endlessly around Yi Qing. His iron cavalry, once dominant on the plains, now struggles to reach the enemies close at hand.

Yi Qing roars in fury, hurling his spear at Archaon. The blade flies straight toward the Everchosen's chest, only to be deflected by a sword swing at the last moment.\\nThe Eye of Sheerian glows ominously, as if mocking the mortal before it. Yi Qing's fate is sealed, just as he is now overwhelmed by demons.
Every inch of land, every drop of blood—no retreat, only forward!
Children of Cathay, fight for your homeland!
The garrison at Weijing will provide continuous support, but beware—the enemy is far more numerous than they appear.
[[col:yellow]]The Dragon Still Stands[[/col]]

Chaos forces are gathering, and the world teeters on the brink of doom... \\n\\nThe Chaos Dwarfs' war machines have breached a section of the Great Bastion, shadowy demons soar over the mountains, and the Everchosen surveys this crumbling empire. Champions revel in the path of destruction, eager to bring Cathay and the world to an end. The battlefield lies in Weijing, where everything will be decided.
The Everchosen's army approaches—we must hold them off!
Do your best to weaken the Warband of Apocalypse's forces.
Repel the second army's assault.
My lord, the Everchosen's forces are advancing. We must deplete his strength here.\\nEliminate his vanguard to blunt his momentum!
The footsteps of destruction grow louder. Another Chaos force appears on the horizon!
Archaon is about to reach the battlefield. The vanguard of the Warband of Apocalypse has launched an attack. We must act swiftly!
Damn it, Archaon is almost here! We lack the strength to face him head-on. Quickly defeat his vanguard and withdraw!
The vanguard of Archaon's forces is on the verge of collapse—victory is within reach!
Archaon's minions are in retreat, dealing a heavy blow to their morale.\\nOur strategic objectives are achieved, my lord. It's time to return to the Great Bastion and regroup with the other forces.
Path of Destruction

Chaos forces are gathering, and the world teeters on the brink of doom... \\n\\nArchaon's army has shattered the northern blockade fleet of the Jade Sea. They have crossed the Red Wall and begun advancing inland. If the Chosen of the Dark Gods reaches the Great Bastion and unites with other warbands, all will be lost. We must intercept him here!
[[col:red]]Final Battle[[/col]]\\nPart One

Chaos forces are gathering, and the world teeters on the brink of doom... \\n\\nArchaon's army has shattered the northern blockade fleet of the Jade Sea. They have crossed the Red Wall and begun advancing inland. If he reaches the Great Bastion and unites with other warbands, all will be lost. We must intercept him here!\\n\\n[[col:red]]Note: If you choose to confront the true end, all settlements along Archaon's path will fall, and your armies in these areas will be forced to retreat.[[/col]]
Stand firm at the gates.
Retreat and organize the defenses.
An endless army roars outside the Great Bastion. Destruction is pounding at Cathay's gates.
Soldiers, destruction is one wall away from Cathay. Behind us lies our homeland. Today, we fight to the death!
My lord, urgent news from the western front—Zhatan has breached the Gate of the Viper!
My lord, the frontline soldiers are almost all dead—we can barely hold on!
My lord, a courier from the east has arrived. The Turtle Gate has fallen to the Changeling, and it plans to flank the Dragon Gate from behind!
The Celestial Strategy Bureau has urgently summoned Hou Qian to intercept the enemy, but their forces are overwhelming. We may need to consider a retreat to avoid being trapped.
Firelight approaches from the horizon.\\nIt's the Chaos Dwarfs' Earthshaker Cannons—scatter quickly!
The siege engines of Chaos minions are nearing—archers, fire at will!
Shadowy Fury demons are swarming over the Great Bastion—we can't hold the walls any longer!
The walls can't hold much longer. The border troops have committed all reserves. We must regroup at the next defensive line!
The followers of the Dark Gods continue to pour over the horizon—they are endless!

The tide of Chaos has engulfed the city. The Great Bastion can no longer be defended. We must not let the Celestial Empire's elite perish here. The allied armies are converging on Weijing. Join them and rally our strength to defy destruction!

The border troops are making a desperate stand to cover our retreat. They will stop at nothing to protect our army's withdrawal from the Great Bastion. As long as your forces survive, we still have a chance to fight back—all for Cathay!
Cleansed by Wind and Rain

Chaos forces are gathering, and the world teeters on the brink of doom... \\n\\nThe winds of magic surge beyond the Great Bastion. The world is heading toward annihilation. All three gates of the Great Bastion are under assault, and the Dragon Empire's armies are stretched thin. The Everchosen has assembled an unimaginably vast army. The endless tide outside the Great Bastion roars with destruction pounding at Cathay's gates.
[[col:red]]Final Battle[[/col]]\\nPart Two

Chaos forces are gathering, and the world teeters on the brink of doom... \\n\\nThe winds of magic surge beyond the Great Bastion. The world is heading toward annihilation. All three gates of the Great Bastion are under assault, and the Everchosen has assembled an unimaginably vast army. The endless tide outside the Great Bastion roars with destruction pounding at Cathay's gates.\\n\\n[[col:red]]Note: If you choose to confront the true end, all settlements along Archaon's path will fall, and your armies in these areas will be forced to retreat.[[/col]]

Chronicle Beyond the Gate
A map of the lands beyond the Great Bastion, drawn by the night scouts of Cathay, marking critical locations identified through years of reconnaissance.
Letters from the Border Troops
Letters from the Great Bastion's border troops entrusted to you. They will never return home, as they held their ground in the face of destruction.
The Dragonchild Whose Name Was Erased
The Unmentionable Dragonchild

The Dragonchild Branded a Traitor
[[col:red]]Battle of Nian'an Temple[[/col]]

In the year Guiyou, the blood of ten prefectures' noble youths flowed like jade into the marsh waters.\\n\\nIn the wild plains under the clear skies, the battle's din ceased; ten thousand celestial soldiers perished in a single day.\\n\\n—Du Fuzi, poet during the Monkey King's reign over Cathay
[[col:red]]Battle of Nian'an Temple[[/col]]

Nian'an Temple, located on the plains north of the Hall of Hao, is a place the scholars of Cathay prefer not to mention. In Imperial Year 2375, three dragon children led their respective palace armies and numerous mortal troops into a brutal and bloody battle here. The clash ended in mutual devastation, with fewer than one-tenth of the armies surviving. Two years later, in 2377, the Monkey King seized power over Cathay.\\nAttempts to de-escalate tensions before the tragedy failed, making this fratricidal conflict a lasting scar on Cathay. The blood of the fallen dyed the Jade River, and the heavy losses shook the foundation of the dragons' rule. Two of the dragon children involved vanished amid ensuing vendettas, and the identity of the third remains unknown.\\n\\n[[img:icon_yang]][[/img]][[img:icon_yin]][[col:red]]You are about to face an extremely challenging battle![[/col]]
Uncover the tragedy of bloodlines turned against each other...

In Imperial Year 2375, during the autumn of Guiyou, on the day after the full moon, ■■■■ led 150,000 troops to this location. Leveraging the perilous terrain of the Jade River and surrounding mountains, they engaged in a decisive battle with the allied forces of ■■■■.

With the first sound of the horn and the thunder of war drums, all sides sent their elite troops to the forefront. The finest soldiers clashed in fierce combat, cutting down banners and generals alike. The battlefield became a scene of carnage, as blood and flesh flew amidst relentless assaults, resembling hell on earth.

Troops from all sides charged forward without fear of death, fighting until corpses covered the land and rivers ran red. By nightfall, neither side could sustain their positions, and fewer than one-tenth of their elite forces remained.
After hours of battle with no clear victor, ■■■■ ordered their cavalry hidden on the western flank to launch an ambush.

■■■■'s cavalry charged down the hill toward the battlefield, but their movement was exposed. ■■■■ immediately responded, deploying their nomadic cavalry to intercept and committing their remaining elite troops to the fray.

Soldiers from all three factions poured into the battlefield. Wave after wave of Cathayan warriors charged, former comrades now bitter enemies, striking down brothers-in-arms in heart-wrenching conflict.
Can Cathay bear the cost of repeating such a tragedy?
Lesson of the Past
[[col:red]]The Song of Steel and Flame[[/col]]

The end times approach, and the apostles of destruction unleash their full fury. Cathay faces massive invasions from all directions. The Eighth Lord gathers his allies to defend the western pass, now overrun by a tide of vermin. The Doom Bell tolls ceaselessly, echoing through the valley. For whom does this funeral bell toll?
[[col:red]]The Song of Steel and Flame[[/col]]

The end times approach, and the apostles of destruction unleash their full fury. Cathay faces massive invasions from all directions. The Eighth Lord gathers his allies to defend the western pass, now overrun by a tide of vermin. The Doom Bell tolls ceaselessly, echoing through the valley. For whom does this funeral bell toll?
Vermin, face the wrath of steel and flame!
Protect the artillery positions.
The vermin attack begins—calibrate the trajectory, light the fuses, and let this desert be their grave!
It's feast time, little rats! Your Lord Gelt has arrived!
At last, the rat leaders reveal themselves. Let them feel the wrath of the Iron Dragon!
Watch out! The vermin are attempting to tunnel into our artillery positions. We cannot let them succeed!
Watch our flanks! These treacherous vermin are trying to encircle us.
Vermin, face the wrath of steel and flame!
The Song of Steel and Flame
[[col:yellow]]Though Storms Swept the Land[[/col]]

The people of Cathay have shed nearly all their blood in this apocalypse, but under your leadership, the Celestial Empire finally sees the light of dawn. Archaon's assault on Weijing has been thwarted. The Dark Gods are dismayed to find that mortals are far less corruptible and fragile than they imagined. Now is the time for Cathay's counterattack. The soldiers are ready—my lord, give the order to reclaim our homeland!

The "Dream Token" is the final masterpiece of the Six Swords of Kunlan. Though each sword is a peerless divine weapon, the Sword Forge deliberately embedded a flaw in each as a safeguard. Unlike the other swords, the Dream Token is neither as sharp nor as light, but it is imbued with a talisman to counter the other swords. Should the day come when the swords clash, the wielder of the Dream Token is meant to step forward and end the strife.
